section.hand:
To my L. T
re
r N
o
10 1591.

addressleaf.section:
Belgia Novem
b
To
my L. Trea
s

page.lettertext:
May it please yo
r
good L. I thought before this, that you had bin moved
by a fitter person then my self, for yo
r
honorable furtherance in a
matter of some suite, w
ch
I have formerly presented. Howbeit
e
parties absense both from
London
and the
Court
doth force me nowe
againe to make mine owne petition, beseeching you most humbly to
remember her
Ma
tie
of my long continuance in this place, and to
intreat her gratious favo
r
, to licence my returne. For besides
many hazardes w
ch
I have incurred in my privat poore estate, by
reason of mine absence, w
ch
I was willinger you should knowe by
some other then my self, and by speeches then by writing, It hath
pleased God of late to calle away my
Father,
to whom I had
commended my domesticall affaires, and
e care of all my state:
and by meanes of his decease, it is at this present muche more
entangled then before, and further domages sustened then I will
troble yo
r
L. to heare reported. But nothing doubting but
at
yo
r
favo
r
unto me is the same that it hath bin, and
at her Ma
tie
wilbe moved w
t
yo
r
L. good persuasion, I relie upon it wholy, and
take my humble leave.
H
a
N
o
1591.
